rationale: 'highly contagious' is a technical term, not an authorial intensifier on a general risk-adjective.
statement_text: Poland, the European Union's largest poultry producer, has reported an outbreak of the highly contagious H5N1 bird flu virus among poultry in the northern part of the country, the World Organisation for Animal Health (WOAH) said on Tuesday.

rationale: 'highly contagious H5N1 bird flu virus' uses 'highly contagious' before a pathogen name, triggering the TECH_TERM_GUARD. 'outbreak' is a neutral noun.
statement_text: Poland, the European Union's largest poultry producer, has reported an outbreak of the highly contagious H5N1 bird flu virus among poultry in the northern part of the country, the World Organisation for Animal Health (WOAH) said on Tuesday.

rationale: 'reported' is a plain verb, not a moderate verb from the list.
statement_text: Poland, the European Union's largest poultry producer, has reported an outbreak of the highly contagious H5N1 bird flu virus among poultry in the northern part of the country, the World Organisation for Animal Health (WOAH) said on Tuesday.
